Summary: Research GmbH setup steps in Austria
Description: Detailed research on legal steps and requirements to establish a GmbH in Austria.

Summary: Estimate initial setup costs & prepare budget
Description: List all expected costs (notary, registration, legal advice, capital) and prepare a budget.
Identify yearly costs such as accounting, WKO fees, social security, etc.

Summary: Choose company name and verify availability
Description: Select a company name and check availability in Austrian company register.
Clearly define the purpose and scope of the business for documents and registration.

Summary: Decide on share capital structure and shareholders
Description: Define how the €35,000 share capital will be distributed among founders.
Decide on the official business address in Austria.
Prepare and draft articles with a lawyer or using a template.

Summary: Find and contact notary for incorporation
Description: Get offers and select a notary for notarizing documents.
Open an Austrian bank account for the company to deposit share capital.
Deposit initial required capital into the bank account and get confirmation.
Sign and notarize articles of association and related documents with notary.
Submit application to court for company registration.
Obtain tax number and VAT registration if required.
Register the managing director and employees (if any) with social insurance.
Register business activity with local authority.
Find and hire an accountant or tax advisor for ongoing compliance.
Complete Austrian Chamber of Commerce registration.

Summary: Set up administrative tools (accounting, project management)
Description: Choose and configure necessary tools and software for operations.
